poem:
Midlife Pages

Alison draws her lines again,  
ink thick with midlife tremors—  
the mirror reflects familiar faces,  
her pen reaches inward,  
mapping the silent crevices.  
She sketches the pulse  
of memory's shadows,  
frames of family, self,  
each strip a whispered chronicle,  
graphic echoes of chapters  
only courage reads aloud.
